intro: Azadehdelia brachyceras, commonly known as the short-capped azadehdelia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters, with small, clustered white or yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Azadehdelia brachyceras is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
